message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CV, cs.CL 

The paper deals with document retrieval and indexing, which falls under the information retrieval (cs.IR) category. The use of random mappings and sparse representations is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG) and data structures (cs.DS). The application of the method to image data sets (corpus of images represented by their color histograms) suggests computer vision (cs.CV) as a possible category. Finally, the use of text-based search engines for indexing documents suggests natural language processing (cs.CL) as another possible category.
